GapFillInput.Title: Future intentions: going to
GapFillInput.Instruction: Use the words in brackets ( ) to make the correct form of going to. Type your answers in each gap. Use short forms.

Content.Question:
1. We're going to have (We / have) lunch at 1 o’clock. Don’t be late!
2. I'm not going to drive (I / not / drive) today.
3. Which DVD are you going to watch (you / watch)?
4. He's going to cook (He / cook) a big pizza for the children.
5. When are you going to start (you / start) your new job, Dave?
6. They're going to get married (They / get married) in June.
7. I'm going to meet (I / meet) Chris for lunch.
8. Where is she going to sleep|'s she going to sleep (she / sleep)?
9. We're going to stay (We / stay) in a hotel in the centre of town.
10. They aren't going to finish (They / not / finish) this week.
